subject: Photography
title: Citizen Journalism and Phone Photography
description: A 60-second lesson on Citizen Journalism and Phone Photography.

hook.text: A bystander films a police incident. The video goes viral. Citizen journalism changed accountability forever.

buildup.text: Camera phones turned billions of people into potential documentarians. Every witness is now a journalist.

discovery.text: Events like the Arab Spring, George Floyd, and natural disasters were documented first by citizens, not press.

twist.text: Citizen journalism lacks editorial standards. Misinformation, manipulated clips, and out-of-context images spread fast.

climax.text: The democratization of photography is both its greatest power and its greatest risk.

punchline.text: Everyone's a journalist now. Not everyone is responsible.

quiz.question: What is a major risk of citizen journalism?
options: Misinformation and out-of-context images spread without editorial standards
Camera phones produce low quality images
Citizens aren't allowed to photograph news
